intro: Veratrum album subsp. misae, commonly known as the Japanese white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers in early summer, which are followed by dark blue berries. It contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
